extension.searchTitle: MAKING IN ORDER CONSIDERATION OF SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 2775, NO SUBSIDIES WITHOUT VERIFICATION ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 159, No. 147

name.namePart: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

extension.searchTitle: NO SUBSIDIES WITHOUT VERIFICATION ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 159, No. 147

congVote.result: So the motion to concur was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to the Rogers (KY) motion to concur in the Senate amendments to H.R. 2775, to condition the provision of premium and cost-sharing subsidies under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act upon a certification that a program to verify household income and other qualifications for such subsidies is operational, by a yea-and-nay vote of 285 yeas to 144 nays, Roll No. 550.

extension.searchTitle: UNANIMOUS CONSENT AGREEMENT--H.R. 2775; Congressional Record Vol. 159, No. 147
NO SUBSIDIES WITHOUT VERIFICATION ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 159, No. 147

congVote.result: The bill, as amended, was ordered to a third reading and was read the third time.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By 81 yeas to 18 nays (Vote No. 219), Senate passed H.R. 2775, making continuing appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30 2014, after taking action on the following amendments proposed thereto:<P/>Reid/Mikulski Amendment No. 2004, to provide continuing appropriations.<P/>Reid Amendment No. 2005, to amend the title.<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 83 yeas to 16 nays (Vote No. 218), three-fifths of those Senators duly chosen and sworn, having voted in the affirmative, Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the bill.

congVote.result: The bill (H.R. 2775), as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By 81 yeas to 18 nays (Vote No. 219), Senate passed H.R. 2775, making continuing appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30 2014, after taking action on the following amendments proposed thereto:
